page.title: 18Rural Attitudes
page.content: {General} People said they had lived in the countryside for many years. All the people interviewed kept pets. No one was lonely and travelled into Aberdeen as little as possible. They bought in bulk, usually at Asda, a Superstore 4 miles away. The fish man, butcher, baker called once a week. Locals have hardly any contact with the Airport, using it when they go abroad on holiday. They experience no noise from the Airport. Surprisingly, the local people report there have been only a few changes in the whole time they have lived in the area. Only the construction of houses and the College of Agriculture at Craibstone changed the surrounding countryside. No one has a desire to live in Aberdeen, prefering the peace of the country.
